Space Delivery
Game Design Document

by Jimmy Lin, Runkai Qiu, Stephen Tang

INTRODUCTION

This document describes a game called “Space Delivery”, which is designed to be a simple, 2D side-scrolling shooter game. The game will employ sprite-based animation, an imaged background, physics, AI, auto-scrolling, and more 2D game techniques.


TECHNOLOGY

Space Delivery will be developed for the Windows Platform using McKilla's Gorilla game engine, a bare-bones engine Richard McKenna developed for rapid prototyping 2D games. All art in the game will be mostly created with Paskel and will be on the simple side.


BACKSTORY

You play as an employee of the “Galaxy Delivery Service” (GDS for short). One day on your delivery route, aliens, or what you think they are, attack you. You, being too underpaid to care, decide to just finish the run and go home.


OBJECTIVE

Your task is to pilot your ship and defend yourself from the oncoming aliens attacking your ship to make sure that your shipment doesn't get damaged or stolen. You are armed with an average delivery ship with minimal weapons, however, you can upgrade your ship to have better weapons.


GAMEPLAY

The game would work as an auto scroller scrolling upwards. You are able to move around the screen while shooting at enemies, you have a booster and a temporary shield that you can deploy.

You would have to be careful as enemies can also shoot at you and attack you in different formations. When they get impaient, they will even come and ram you

When an enemy is defeated, they have a chance of dropping scrap, the material that you use to repair and upgrade your ship.

Enemy Name Enemy Type Description
Common Mook Regular Enemy The average alien that you run into, they don't do much other than shoot lasers that's not even aimed at you
Targeted Mooks Regular Enemy The better than the Common Mook, Targeted Mooks at least aim at you
Looters Regular Enemy These guys don't attack you at all, They come on screen and move around for no reason. When defeated, they always drop scrap
Mega Mook BOSS A bigger and badder version of the common mook, This guy will shoot lasers at you while summoning other mooks

More enemies may be added based on Time


CONTROLS

This game will be played using only a keyboard

  • W - Move Up
  • A - Move Left
  • S - Move Down
  • D - Move Right
  • SPACE - Shoot
  • E - Activates Shield
  • R - Activates Booster
  • ESC - Pauses/Unpauses the Game

GRAPHICAL USER INTERFACE

  • Splash Screen - The splash screen GUI simply presents a game logo and a Start button for the user to press when they are ready to play.

  • Main Menu - The first Menu players see when entering our game, Players will have the following options to pick from:
    • Level Selection - A screen that allows players to select the level to play
    • Controls - If pressed, A screen that displays the controls open up
    • Help - If pressed, A screen that displays the backstory and credits open up

  • Gameplay GUI - Once the game starts, the following will be displayed at all times:
    • Player Health
    • Scrap Collected - the amount of scrap that was collected
    • Shield Charges - A charge level for the shield
    • Booster Charge - A charge level for how much speed boosters, they have
    • Wave number - a number telling the players what wave they are on
  • Gameplay Pause Menu - Once the game is paused, the following will be displayed at all times:
    • Resume Game - If pressed, continues the game
    • Exit Game - If pressed, exits the game
    • Controls - If pressed, A screen that displays the controls open up

ARTWORK

All artwork in the game will be original. The following needs to be created

Background:

At least one background is needed

Player:

The player sprite would need the follwing animations:

  • IDLE- default animation
  • DAMAGED- when the player is hit
  • SHILDED- when a shield is active
  • BOOSTING- when a speed boost is active
  • DYING- for when the player dies

Enemies:

Enemy Name Size Animations Needed
Common Mook 1 x 1 IDLE, DAMAGED, DYING
Targeted Mooks 1 x 1 IDLE, DAMAGED, DYING
Looters 1 x 1 IDLE, DAMAGED, DYING
Mega Mook 3 x 3 IDLE, DAMAGED, DYING, ROARING

SOUND EFFECTS

All sound effects will be original. Sounds must be made to coincide with each of the following events:

  • Shielding
  • Boosting
  • Shooting
  • Enemy Shooting
  • Bullet Hit Enemy
  • Bullet Hit Player
  • Bullet Hit Shield
  • Enemy Dying
  • Dying

MUSIC

If time permits, Game Music will be added.
